data.title: icon.png still uses old logo
data.body:
**Godot version:**
Master

**Issue description:**
The logo has been changed, but `icon.png` is still the old one.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a new project.

data.title: Print errors to the debugger with GDScript's printerr function
data.body:
**Issue description:**

So, `printerr` currently doesn't do much. It simply logs the message to the console, not even to the built-in log, and I don't know about you, but I never check that console. And even if you do, you just won't spot your tiny little message between loads of other prints.
So my proposal is to make it log stuff to the debugger's error log, or at least to the editor log, maybe in red. (although that would be very hard to do)

data.title: Fix bug that causes Objects in Arrays to always be null in the debugger
data.body:
Fixes #8206 
UPDATE: It works perfectly now. You can dive into objects even in embedded arrays. Only small problem is that the array editor says that objects are integers but I think it can be fixed if it turns out to be confusing.
BTW the debugger brings up an error if you open a node in the inspector that isn't in the tree. I guess it wasn't a problem so far because it was impossible to open such nodes, but now imo this error should be removed.

data.title: Fix inverted logic for atlas repeat (2.1)
data.body:
Not very important, but was incorrect.

Not relevant for _master_ due to its brand new export workflow.

data.title: RigidBody with polygon shape has weird physics.
data.body:
**Godot version: Master f527a6946**


**Issue description:**
RigicBody2D nodes with polygon shapes have some weird physics.

![brknrigid1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/25660034/db00530a-2fe0-11e7-9fed-b033a7d275ed.gif)

![brknrigid2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10215987/25660037/e01c118a-2fe0-11e7-8aac-d5505b4d881b.gif)


**Steps to reproduce:**
Try the example project with visible collision shapes enabled (can't draw polygons not even with _draw yet).
Modify the polygon keeping the lower vertex position and the result is always the same.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[brokenrigid.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/973284/brokenrigid.zip)
Added an extra rigid body for a more strange effect.

data.title: LineEdit: fix placeholder text affected by secret
data.body:
First PR, please be gentle. :)
Just a small fix to the LineEdit so that the placeholder text isn't displayed as asterisks.

data.title: Allow hiDpi and hiDpi enabled
data.body:
**Godot version: 3.0**


**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
To use hiDpi themes in your own project you need to enable `allow hiDpi` + `enable hiDpi`
Those two settings are at different locations and it might lead to frustration.
If they have different peruses it would be great if `enable hiDpi` would prompt a message which mentions, that `allow hiDpi` needs to be activated too.
If there is no reason in `allow hiDpi` it also would be possible to remove it.

data.title: Scan file selection font color broken
data.body:
Godot 3rd may build Kubuntu 17.04 x64

File selection dialog window shows files in black font in project manager (you can see font color set in theme resource on folders). Issue is present in default theme too.

Other file selection widgets display color properly.

STR: 1. Select "Scan" in project manager. 
2. Navigate to a folder that contains any files in it.

![spectacle j13328](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10696955/25650511/07ee62f8-2fe6-11e7-93ea-1d6f0ab986c3.png)

Just by closing the game directly instead of stoping it from the editor, and randomly while the game is running...

data.title: Add double-sided flag to SpriteBase3D [master]
data.body:
Version of https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/8434 `cherry-pick`ed for `master`. Some of the code this modifies is currently commented-out, so the rendering can't be tested, but this compiles and the flag does show up properly in the editor.

If https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/8434 is merged for 2.1, this should be merged for master at the same time.

data.title: Scene editor not shows node struct when redo
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux XUbuntu 16.04.2, Godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
When open a new project and add a Node2D and save and undo and redo, the node not shows in the scene editor. The error is not shows the nodes when redo.

**Steps to reproduce:**
-open a project
-add Node2D and save
-now press Ctrl+Z
-so pess Ctrl+Shift+Z
-see in the scene editor, the node not shown
-now add other Node2D and it it will be shown as sub node of the firstly added

data.title: HTML5: Cursor style control
data.body:
Implement `OS::set_cursor_shape` for the HTML5 platform.
Basically, hovering over a LineEdit displays a text-cursor now

data.title: Add support for OpenSSL 1.1.0 or later
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
All, but mainly Linux/*BSD - master.

**Issue description:**
Godot currently can't build against OpenSSL 1.1.0, only against OpenSSL 1.0.x (we ship 1.0.2h in `thirdparty/openssl`).

`modules/openssl/stream_peer_openssl.cpp` should be updated to build against the new API. Ideally, it should be able to build against both 1.0.x and 1.1.0, we might be able to use conditional version checks to use the proper API. Eventually, the bundled source should also be updated so that we can continue benefiting from upstream security fixes.

**Workaround:**
For the time being we should probably default to using the bundled openssl code on X11 (`builtin_openssl=yes`). Most people providing unofficial binaries don't pay attention to this, and users of distros defaulting to OpenSSL 1.1.0 can't run those binaries without installing a compat package, when provided.

data.title: Not loading resources when trying to run the project from the editor.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux Mint 18.1 x86_64 , Godot 2.1 stable release

**Issue description:**
Older versions of godot can edit the game fine, but ever since 2.1 I can play the game ny hitting "run" in the loader, but if I try to edit the game, when running from the editor it simply crashes, giving me the following error:

ERROR: load: No loader found for resource: res://$exec
   At: core/io/resource_loader.cpp:210.
ERROR: start: Failed loading scene: res://$exec
   At: main/main.cpp:1401.
ERROR: ~List: Condition ' _first != __null ' is true.
   At: core/self_list.h:80.
ERROR: ~List: Condition ' _first != __null ' is true.
   At: core/self_list.h:80.
ERROR: free: Attempt to free invalid ID
   At: servers/spatial_sound/spatial_sound_server_sw.cpp:598.
ERROR: free: Attempt to free invalid ID
   At: servers/spatial_sound_2d/spatial_sound_2d_server_sw.cpp:595.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a project using a prior version of godot -> try to run it inside the editor in the current stable release (2.1).
Naturally the thing is probably much more complex than that but I'm kinda lost since it is already a very large project.

Any aid will be deeply appreciated :)

data.title: Fix get_shader_type index upper bound
data.body:
This should fix part of the "editing shader code crashes the editor" problem from issues #8595 and #8314.  Using the "create new material shader" repro steps from #8314 as an example, p_code (the code text from the shader editor) starts as a string of length zero which results in an invalid p_code[0] reference in line 3756.

This now properly extracts the shader type (you can verify this by creating a new ShaderMaterial, editing it, and typing a valid shader type declaration, such as "shader_type spatial;"

From what I have gathered there are actually two bugs with similar symptoms:
1. This indexing problem fixed here (which results in a segmentation fault), which is current hit every time you try to type in the shader editor.
2. a segmentation fault on line 2291 of rasterizer_storage_gles3.cpp when attempting to call material->shader->uniforms.front().  This is sometimes hit right after clicking "New Shader" in the ShaderMaterial dropdown menu, but the failure seems to be nondeterministic.  Sometimes it fails on the first click, sometimes it takes multiple tries.  I couldn't figure it out after a cursory glance.  I'm hoping someone with a little more context can help me out.  I'm new to this code :)

If you encounter an error when validating this fix, make sure you didn't hit the second bug mentioned above (because when it does occur, it happens first)

data.title: Rendering is broken on UWP
data.body: Just as a note to remind that the renderer is not working on UWP. I managed to get a GLES3 context but it still doesn't work with 3D games.

data.title: WindowDialog with custom panel background crashes godot
data.body:
godot 3.0 30th april build Kubuntu 17.04 x64

STR: 1. Have a theme that sets WindowDialog/styles/panel to anything other than null
2. Open anything that uses WindowDialog (Export menu for example)
